content.raw: Have a look at [#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3174/fix-gazebo9-build-and-run-on-windows/diff#chg-gazebo/rendering/RenderEngine.cc](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3174/fix-gazebo9-build-and-run-on-windows/diff#chg-gazebo/rendering/RenderEngine.cc) . This was the only chnge I really needed to do to build Gazebo 9 with OGRE 1.10 on Windows. That’s because the prebuilt OGRE library from Open Robotics CDN is built with \`OGRE\_RESOURCEMANAGER\_STRICT\` set to 2. For systems where OGRE 1.10 is built with this flag set to 0, no changes are needed \(it seems\).
content.html: Have a look at #!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3174/fix-gazebo9-build-and-run-on-windows/diff#chg-gazebo/rendering/RenderEngine.cc . This was the only chnge I really needed to do to build Gazebo 9 with OGRE 1.10 on Windows. That’s because the prebuilt OGRE library from Open Robotics CDN is built with `OGRE_RESOURCEMANAGER_STRICT` set to 2. For systems where OGRE 1.10 is built with this flag set to 0, no changes are needed (it seems).
